name: Hampton Inn Burlington

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hampton Inn has been consistent with my experience at other Hampton Inns over two stays so far. If you usually like them, you'll probably have a good experience here as well.
reviews.title: Reasonable location, decent value
What I would expect
reviews.text: It's a deceptively large hotel due to the very strange layout, but overall the room count isn't all that high despite the size- most of the rooms are pretty big as a result. It wasn't originally a Hampton, and some signs show of its previous life. AC units and some bathroom fixtures are not new, but are generally functional and the place is pretty clean. There's a pool and fitness room that are also decent given the size of the place and the location. Elevators can be slowish, but it's only a couple of floors and there are plenty of staircases.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As usual for Hamptons, breakfast is a huge perk, along with infinite coffee availability near the lobby.
reviews.title: Good hotel for a Burlington stay

reviews.text: Stayed here last weekend instead of downtown as we normally would due to last minute change of plans. The location easy to get too, right off the highway and close to downtown Burlington. The room was large and clean and we were pleasantly greeted upon our arrival and throughout our stay. The room was spacious and clean, the breakfast is generally consistent with other Hampton Inns. Overall, a pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Always have a great stay here

reviews.text: Just trying to make our way home after a long vacation trip, we picked this Hampton Inn at random. It was a good choice. Room hadn't been updated recently, but it was large, and well appointed. Breakfast buffets had good offerings. Room refrigerator was quiet. We slept well.
reviews.title: I'll definitely be back !

reviews.text: Very nice hotel, very crowded on a summer week-end with lots of kids in the pool, etc. Altho we were concerned that our room was next to the elevator and the pool, our room was quiet, spacious and very clean. Cookies every night and lucious breakfast almost up to other Hamptons we've stayed at. Hubby asked for eggs with no meat on day when western omelets were the only egg offering, and breakfast hostess said there were none. At other Hamptons, the staff go out of their way to bring vegetarian hubby meat free eggs - of course, he tips nicely! All in all, it was a very nice stay.
reviews.title: Almost up to Hampton Standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been staying here for years on our way to/from the Maritimes. It's not cheap, but it's reliable, clean, comfortable, and pet-friendly. It's located right off the Interstate. It offers a solid breakfast to get you on your way in the morning. Best of all, it's right next door to Costco, where you can stock up on Jelly Bellies and get your $1.50 hot dog and a coke.
reviews.title: Reliable, clean, comfortable, pet-friendly lodging

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Typical of most hampton inns, this one is more of the same. Large common room with access to coffee and tea 24/7, fresh-baked cookies in the evening, and a breakfast buffet in the morning.
reviews.title: Easy choice!

reviews.text: This particular one is very well situated, right off the 89, 2 exits from Burlington. Despite the proximity to the highway, it is actually very quiet (especially if you get a room on the 4th floor facing the parking lot (and away from the highway), and the beds are very comfortable. Bathrooms are spacious, and most rooms have a comfortable sofa to lounge in.
reviews.title: Still the place to stay

reviews.text: Unfortunately, our room was facing the rising sun, and the window coverings were inadequate in blocking the sun. So at 6 am, it was as if all the lights on the room had been turned on. It is a bit aggravating when you are planning on sleeping in.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another night on our New England road trip in beautiful Vermont. Lovely hotel, plenty of amenities, and a fabulous breakfast. The staff were professional, courteous and friendly, the location reasonable.
reviews.title: Very nice, but a little pricey

reviews.text: I did ruin a pair of white socks by walking around the room in them, so cleanliness was not 100%. The carpet felt damp and gritty underfoot.
reviews.title: Clean Hampton

reviews.text: Clean updated Hampton inn. I got a
reviews.title: Great hotel, front desk slightly chilly; Dog friendly!

reviews.text: King bedroom suite and man was it huge! Dishwasher, fridge, stove top the works. I would stay here again! The rooms were clean although the carpet felt a little strange but I always wear slippers in hotels.
reviews.title: No compassion for families of Fletcher Allen patients

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a great time here, despite a front desk which just didn't match Hampton's usual style (two of the folks had the "we'll look up and greet you when we get to it" mentality...I'm a fan of the "I'm looking up and smiling to acknowledge you, even though I am writing something down"). You can be busy and still not make your guests feel like they are being ignored.
reviews.title: Showing Its Age But Reasonably Priced

reviews.text: Stayed here during National Triathlon. The staff was friendly and helpful. We went to the front desk for more in room coffee pods and were told they were out but had coffee in the lobby 24/7. The next day after being gone all day and returning to the room, there were 6 extra pods! Thanks! Our room was clean and spacious. We used the pull out bed in the sofa and it wasn't that bad. They have fresh cookies in the lobby at 8:30 each night which is a nice touch. Breakfast was pretty good with a variety of waffles, an egg dish, meat fresh fruit, fresh oatmeal with your choice of toppings and cereal. They have done some recent renovations and the lobby is beautiful and furniture in the room was new. The air and heat were older but worked fine. High speed internet worked great. The restaurant next door had a "temporarily closed" sign on it so I can't comment on that. My complaint..... Price gouging. We were told that since they were almost full, we couldn't use any discounts. We are Hilton Honors members as well as AARP. We were charged $235 the first night and then the price went up to $259 for Friday and Saturday. I saw a bunch of people checking out on Saturday morning so asked if we could use our member discount. I was told they were fully booked for that night ( I later saw the cleaning staff cleaning a room at 9 that same night). The desk clerk said she could give me 10% off making it $249. I asked if she could at least match the first night's rate, which she did. This was a nice place but we felt taken advantage of. Don't go here during a famine! They'll stick a fork in you while you're still breathing!
reviews.title: Great place to stay but a bit of price gouging.

reviews.text: This was our first visit to Vermont. Have stayed at other Hampton Inn's and have enjoyed our stay thus decided to try this one. We arrived at 12:30pm so decided to go straight to the hotel in hopes of an early check in. Our double family room suite was ready so we checked in. Our room had 2 double beds, a microwave, fridge, a big bathroom and a sitting area with sofa and chair. Oh did I mention the flat screen TV. The room smelled and looked clean. Plenty of space for the three of us for our 2 night stay. The free internet was fast. Breakfast was free as well, ample choices of hot and cold choices to get you going in the morning. Took a dip in the pool which was heated and clean. Towels are provided free of charge so no need to bring yours from home. The hotel is situated a 10 min drive from downtown Burlington easy and convinient. Do take advantage of the free 2 hr parking at public parking area (pick up a map from the lobby for locations). Close to factory outlets in Essex Junction and a 20min drive to Ben and Jerry factory. Enjoyed the milk and cookies at 8:30pm each night. You won't be disappointed if you book this hotel
reviews.title: Great location and stay

reviews.text: I've been staying at this Hampton Inn on and off for the last ten years. I've always loved it! The Front Desk staff is great, I had the pleasure of meeting Walt on my most recent stay; he's awesome! I somehow even managed to run into the Director of Sales, Ed, while there! This was a pleasure as well. (I've been to a few organized events done at the Hampton). I can find nothing wrong with the hotel. Except for maybe the Post It notes on the beds....and I understand that this is a standard in all of their hotels...it's 'quirky' and a bit odd. Of course, this is only my opinion. Again, this place is just great and I know that I will make my way there again, and soon! Keep up the good work!
reviews.title: Excellence!

reviews.text: Just returned from a vacation through Maine, New Hampshire and Vermont. For the past decade, I have traveled on business to Burlington 4 - 5 times a year. I've stayed at hotels downtown, near the airport (avoid ALL of them at the airport/mall) and in Colchester. This was only my second time staying at this Hampton Inn. I'm comfortable saying that I won't stay anywhere else from now on. We had originally booked our stay at the Residence Inn. I wanted more space for my family to spread out and thought it would be the perfect fit. After checking into the Residence Inn, we (she) decided that we were going to look for a less expensive alternative. We (she) booked the rest of our vacation at the Hampton Inn, Colchester and in the end, I'm thrilled we did. The hotel's lobby and rooms have all been recently remodeled. The hotel was spotlessly clean and well cared for. It is an older hotel with a modern feel. The part that blew me away and will keep me coming back was the staff. It wasn't one specific person, but every one of them made us feel special. The hotel has 200 rooms and yet the employees all treated us like we were family. An older gentleman at the front desk and his manager went out of their way to help my wife plan our itinerary..."go here, not there, eat here and avoid that place". They were spot on with all their recommendations, saved us money and ensured that we had a great vacation. My kids LOVED the pool, breakfast and cookies each night. Great visit and I can't wait to bring my family back with me in a few years.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has the usual features of a Hampton Inn. The outside of the building looks quite new however the rooms are looking a bit dated and tired. That said, the rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable and the breakfast had something for everyone. The staff were okay, but not outstanding. The complimentary cookies were a treat. There is not much in the way of restaurants within walking distance.
reviews.title: Standard Hampton Inn

description: The Hampton Inn Burlington is conveniently located at Exit 16 off of Interstate 89 in Colchester, VT. The hotel features the complimentary "On the House" Hot breakfast buffet each morning with a brand new make your own waffle station. This great property also has free parking, complimentary High Speed Wireless Internet Access and cookies and milk each night.
